definition: nickname for a panda
to surge on/to roll on
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
plump
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza

sentences.english: Time of water roll away, no plan.
sentences.chinese: 光陰之水滾滾而逝，無計挽留。

sentences.english: As long as the health care system will pay the price, the money will flow in that direction.
sentences.chinese: 只要有醫療系統來買單，錢就會滾滾而來。

sentences.english: Qishui waves rolling in, spray wet the car curtain .
sentences.chinese: 淇水波濤滾滾，水花打溼了車上的布幔。

sentences.english: Technical onrush always is billow forward, vast and mighty, cannot hold back.
sentences.chinese: 技術洪流總是滾滾向前，浩浩蕩蕩，無法阻擋。

sentences.english: Like the Yellow River,time keeps rolling along.
sentences.chinese: 時間像黃河一樣不斷滾滾奔騰向前。

sentences.english: River is flowing into the east.
High-quality goods and high-rank service enable them to gain profits from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 優質商品和優質服務，使他們財源滾滾。

sentences.english: The Changjiang River keeps rolling along toward the east.
This heat wave is keeping temperatures high all day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一整天都熱浪滾滾。

sentences.english: Fireworks! Man, you hear them scratch, metal over metal.
sentences.chinese: 火花滾滾，你們聽到它們相互刮擦，金屬之間。

sentences.english: There were green waves of yearning for life still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 滾滾湧來的綠浪，渴望着仍所未知的生命。

sentences.english: Or “sell your soul and the money follows.
sentences.chinese: 或者說，“出賣你的靈魂而財源滾滾”。

sentences.english: Thousands of events in the past pours into my mind. By toasting the void, I lament the bygone heroes.
sentences.chinese: 數千年往事注到心頭，把酒凌虛，嘆滾滾英雄誰在？

sentences.english: Beyond the illusionary screen, summer heat is billowing.
sentences.chinese: 幻覺的屏風之外，夏天，熱浪滾滾。

sentences.english: The words flowed unbidden from my pen.
sentences.chinese: 這些字句從我的筆端滾滾流出。
我的生意確然很成功，金錢滾滾而來。

to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
Wan Li (1916-2015), PRC politician
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
far away/thousands of miles/10000 li
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
Pentium (microprocessor by Intel)
vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
lit. ten thousand fathoms/fig. extremely high or deep/lofty/bottomless
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
whole sky
Yellow River or Huang He
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
wind-borne/tossed about by the wind
Mancheng county in Baoding 保定[Bao3 ding4], Hebei
(literary) the vast sky/(finance) eventual downturn/poor prospects in the long term
loud sound
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
